definition: to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of

sentences.english: Yang state board of trade each big trading company surrender a book.
sentences.chinese: 扬州商会各大商行的投诚书。

sentences.english: Iranian scientist Shahram Amiri, Kidnapped or a defecting Spy?
sentences.chinese: 伊朗科学家阿米里，绑架或间谍投诚？

sentences.english: The officer sheepishly postponed the announcement of his defection temporarily.
sentences.chinese: 军官羞怯地要求延迟公布他关于投诚的临时声明。

sentences.english: TouCheng, whole wild goose mountain is immersed in a festival atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 日自己投诚，整个雁山都沉浸在喜庆的氛围中。

definition: to surrender and pay allegiance to
to rely on help from sb
to realign one's allegiance (to another religion, ruler etc)/to submit
to instigate (rebellion etc)/incitement (e.g. to desertion within opposing camp)
to vow loyalty and devotion to
to enlist enemy or rebel soldiers by offering amnesty/to bring to negotiated surrender
to betray one's party/to defect (from the communist party)/renegade faction
to incorporate into one's troops/to weave in
to change sides in a war/turncoat
to go over to the enemy/to defect
